text:
This is probably just something that hasn't been implemented yet but I figured
I'd submit this anyway. If nothing else the attached file could be a test case.

Accorinding to the FO spec a fo:table-column is optional in a fo:table but FOP
seems to ignore tables/columns that don't use fo:table-column.
creator: sandymac@ufl.edu

text:
Created attachment 1174
example of tables with/without fo:table-column
creator: sandymac@ufl.edu

text:
This is an importand bug because a lot people want generate pdf from html or
xhtml files. If you have a lot html or xhtml files and want to convert them for
example with css2fop.jar you get problems with every table. because people
normaly don't define a table with colgroup/col tags
creator: beat.binotto@7isolutions.com
pascal.sancho@takoma.fr
text: Bug fixed in latest Trunk (rev 584703), and probably in all FOP 0.9x
batch transition pre-FOP1.0 resolved+fixed bugs to closed+fixed
creator: gadams@apache.org
